robot_pose_publisher.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 import rospy
3 import tf
4 import sys
5 from geometry_msgs.msg import PoseStamped, Pose
6 
7 class RobotPosePublisher:
8  def __init__(self,namespace):
9  listener = tf.TransformListener()
10  rate = rospy.Rate(10.0)
11  base_link = namespace +'/base_link'
12 
13  self.pub = rospy.Publisher('robot_pose', PoseStamped, queue_size=10)
14 
15  while not rospy.is_shutdown():
16  try:
17  (trans,rot) = listener.lookupTransform('/map', base_link, rospy.Time(0))
18 
19  pose = PoseStamped()
20  pose.header.frame_id = '/map'
21  pose.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
22 
23  pose.pose.position.x = trans[0]
24  pose.pose.position.y = trans[1]
25  pose.pose.position.z = trans[2]
26 
27  pose.pose.orientation.x = rot[0]
28  pose.pose.orientation.y = rot[1]
29  pose.pose.orientation.z = rot[2]
30  pose.pose.orientation.w = rot[3]
31 
32  self.pub.publish(pose)
33 
34  except (tf.LookupException, tf.ConnectivityException, tf.ExtrapolationException):
35  continue
36 
37 if __name__ == '__main__':
38  # initialize node
39  rospy.init_node('robot_pose_publisher')
40  rospy.loginfo("Running robot pose publisher node")
41 
42  # Get the arguments
43  args = rospy.myargv(argv=sys.argv)
44  if(len(args) != 2):
45  rospy.logwarn('need to define tf for baselink')
46  exit()
47  namespace = args[1]
48  R = RobotPosePublisher(namespace)
